author: Staff Reporter
text:
S. Kaviya, a Plus-One student of KSR Akshara Academy, has won the online contest on ‘Digital Wellness Online Challenge (DWOC)’ conducted for school students from Standards VI to Plus-Two across the country.

Organised by the Union Department of Electronics and Information Technology, the contest was held between July 1 and 17, 2015 to make students aware about maintaining digital wellness by taking informed decisions and become safe and responsible users of digital technology.

The objective was to test how students were protecting themselves from threats faced in cyber space. Among the 144 participants, four students from each State were selected.

Kaviya won in the ‘senior girls’ category.

At an award function held at Stein Auditorium in New Delhi recently, Union Minister for Communication and Information Technology and Law and Justice Ravi Shankar Prasad presented the award to Kaviya.

Chairman of KSR Institutions, K.S. Rangasamy; director of Akshara Academy Amutha Aasaithambee; principal R. Vijayalakshmi; and teachers and students appreciated her efforts.
title: Namakkal girl wins online contest
